tit.cmt: 琵琶湖疏水→Lake Biwa Canal[定訳不明]

sen.j: 琵琶湖疏水（びわこそすい、「疏」が常用漢字外であり「疎」に書き換えられるため琵琶湖疎水とも表記される）とは、琵琶湖の湖水を、京都市へ運ぶために作られた水路（疏水）である。
sen.e: Biwako Sokui (琵琶湖疏水) or Lake Biwa Canal (since 疏 is not included in the national list of Chinese characters in common use, 疎 is also used as in 琵琶湖疎水) is a waterway that was built to transport water of Lake Biwa to Kyoto City.

Biwako Sokui (琵琶湖疏水) or Lake Biwa Canal (since 疏 is not included in the national list of Chinese characters in common use, 疎 is also used as in 琵琶湖疎水) is a waterway that was built to transport water from Lake Biwa to Kyoto City.

Biwako Sokui (琵琶湖疏水) or Lake Biwa Canal (since 疏 is not included in the national list of Chinese characters in common use, 疎 is also used as in 琵琶湖疎水) is a waterway that was built to transport water from Lake Biwa to Kyoto City.

sen.j: 現在は水道用水としての用途が最も多くなっているが、完成当初から水力発電（営業用として日本初）が行われ、その電力を利用した日本初の電車（京都電気鉄道、のち買収されて京都市電）が開業するなど京都の近代化に貢献した。
sen.e: Although it is mainly used for tap water now, since it was completed it had been used for hydroelectric power generation (Japan's first commercial hydroelectric power) which contributed to Japan's modernization, such as Japan's first operation of electric railcars (Kyoto Electric Railway, which was later bought by Kyoto Municipal Streetcar).
sen.cmt: 京都市電→Kyoto Municipal Streetcar[定訳不明]
sen.e: Although it is mainly used for tap water now, since it was completed it has been used for hydroelectric power generation (Japan's first commercial hydroelectric power) which contributed to Japan's modernization, such as Japan's first operation of electric railcars (Kyoto Electric Railway, which was later bought by Kyoto Municipal Streetcar).

Although it is mainly used for tap water now, since it was completed it has been used for hydroelectric power generation (Japan's first commercial hydroelectric power) which contributed to Kyoto's modernization, such as Japan's first operation of electric railcars (Kyoto Electric Railway, which was later bought by Kyoto Municipal Streetcar).

sen.j: また、水運にも用いられ、琵琶湖（大津）と京都、京都と伏見・淀川を結んだ。
sen.e: It was also used for freight transportation, connecting Lake Biwa (Otsu) and Kyoto, Kyoto and Fushimi, as well as Kyoto and Yodo-gawa River.
It was also used for freight transportation, connecting Lake Biwa (Otsu) and Kyoto, Kyoto and Fushimi, as well as Kyoto and Yodo-gawa River.
It was also used for freight transportation, connecting Lake Biwa (Otsu) and Kyoto, Kyoto and Fushimi, as well as Kyoto and the Yodo-gawa River.

sen.j: 高低差の大きい部分にはケーブルカーインクライン（傾斜鉄道）と呼ばれる線路が敷かれ、船を線路上の台車に載せて移動させた。
sen.e: A railroad called Cable Car Incline (slope railway) was built to connect places of large difference in height, which allowed boats to be placed on a dolly to move on land.
sen.cmt: ケーブルカーインクライン（傾斜鉄道）→Cable Car Incline (slope railway)[定訳不明]
sen.e: A railroad called Cable Car Incline (slope railway) was built to connect places of large difference in height, which allowed boats to be placed on a dolly to move on land.
A railroad called Cable Car Incline (slope railway) was built to connect places of large difference in height, which allowed boats to be placed on a dolly to move on land.

sen.j: 水運の消滅に伴いインクラインはいずれも廃止されたが、蹴上インクラインでは一部の設備が静態保存されている。
sen.e: Although the inclines were abolished along with the demise of water transportation, part of the facilities of Keage Incline has been preserved (not working).
Although the inclines fell into disuse along with the demise of water transportation, part of the facilities of Keage Incline has been preserved (although they are currently not working).
sen.cmt: 「were abolished」→「fell into disuse」, 「although they are currently」挿入
sen.e: Although the inclines fell into disuse along with the demise of water transportation, part of the facilities of Keage Incline has been preserved (although they are currently not working).

sen.j: なお、現在でも無鄰菴や平安神宮神苑をはじめ、東山の社寺等の庭園の水としても利用されている。
sen.e: The canal is now used for garden water of shrines and temples in Higashiyama area, such as Murinan and the Garden of Heian Jingu Shrine.
The canal is now used for garden water for shrines and temples in the Higashiyama area, such as Murinan and the Garden of Heian Jingu Shrine.
The canal is now used for garden water for shrines and temples in the Higashiyama area, such as Murinan and the Garden of Heian Jingu Shrine.

sen.j: 国の史跡に指定されている。
sen.e: It is designated as a National Historical Site.
It is designated as a National Historical Site.
It is designated as a National Historical Site.

sen.j: また、疏水百選の一つである。
sen.e: It is also listed on the selection of 100 fine canals in Japan called "Sosui Hyakusen" (疏水百選).
sen.cmt: 疏水百選→→the selection of 100 fine canals in Japan called Sosui Hyakusen[定訳不明]
sen.e: It is also listed on the selection of 100 fine canals in Japan called "Sosui Hyakusen" (疏水百選).
It is also listed on the selection of 100 fine canals in Japan called Sosui Hyakusen (疏水百選).

sen.j: 明治維新と東京奠都に伴い京都市は人口が減少し産業も衰退したため、第3代京都府知事の北垣国道が灌漑、上水道、水運、水車の動力を目的とした琵琶湖疏水を計画。
sen.e: Because industry and population of Kyoto City declined after Meiji Restoration and the capital was transferred to Tokyo, Kunimichi KITAGAKI, the third governor of Kyoto Prefecture, planned Lake Biwa Water Canal aiming at irrigation, public water supply, transportation, and generating power for water wheels.

Because the industry and population of Kyoto City declined after the Meiji Restoration and the capital was transferred to Tokyo, Kunimichi KITAGAKI, the third governor of Kyoto Prefecture, planned Lake Biwa Canal with irrigation, public water supply, transportation, and generating power for water wheels in mind.

Because the industry and population of Kyoto City declined after the Meiji Restoration and the capital was transferred to Tokyo, Kunimichi KITAGAKI, the third governor of Kyoto Prefecture, planned Lake Biwa Canal with irrigation, public water supply, transportation, and generating power for water wheels in mind.

sen.j: 主任技術者として田辺朔郎を任じ設計にあたらせた。
sen.e: He assigned Sakuro TANABE as a chief engineer to design the canal.
He assigned Sakuro TANABE as chief engineer to design the canal.
He assigned Sakuro TANABE as chief engineer to design the canal.

sen.j: 第1疏水は1885年（明治18年）に着工し、1890年（明治23年）に大津から鴨川合流点までと、蹴上から分岐する疏水分線が完成した。
sen.e: In 1885, construction of First Canal or Dai-ichi Sosui started, and a part of the waterway that connected Otsu and Kamogawa River confluence point, and another part Sosuibunsen Canal, which branches out at Keage, were completed in 1890.
sen.cmt: 第1疏水→First Canal[定訳不明]鴨川合流点→the confluence point of Kamogawa River[定訳不明]
sen.e: In 1885, construction of First Canal or Dai-ichi Sosui started, and a part of the waterway that connected Otsu and the Kamogawa River confluence point, and another part Sosuibunsen Canal, which branches out at Keage, were completed in 1890.

In 1885, construction of First Canal or Dai-ichi Sosui started, and a part of the waterway that connected Otsu and the Kamogawa River confluence point, and another part Sosuibunsen Canal, which branches out at Keage, were completed in 1890.

sen.j: 第1疏水（大津～鴨川合流点間）と疏水分線の建設には総額125万円の費用を要し、その財源には産業基立金、京都府、国費、地方債や寄付などのほか、市民に対しての目的税も充てられた。
sen.e: The construction of First Canal (connecting Otsu and the confluence point of Kamogawa River) and Sosuibunsen cost \1.25 million in total, which was financed by communal industrial funds, prefectural expenditures, national bonds, municipal bonds, donations, and special taxes on citizens of Kyoto City.

The construction of First Canal (connecting Otsu and the confluence point of Kamogawa River) and Sosuibunsen cost \1.25 million in total, which was financed by communal industrial funds, prefectural expenditures, national bonds, municipal bonds, donations, and special taxes on the citizens of Kyoto City.

The construction of First Canal (connecting Otsu and the confluence point of the Kamo-gawa River) and Sosuibunsen cost \1.25 million in total, which was financed by communal industrial funds, prefectural expenditures, national bonds, municipal bonds, donations, and special taxes on the citizens of Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: "Kamogawa River"→"the Kamo-gawa River"に変更しました。

sen.j: また、水力発電は当初の計画には無かったが、田邉らがアメリカで視察したアイデアを取り入れ、日本初の営業用水力発電所となる蹴上発電所を建設し、1891年（明治24年）に運転が開始された。
sen.e: Although the hydroelectric power generation was not included in the initial plan, using ideas of Tanabe and other engineers inspired by their study tour in the US, they built Japan's first hydroelectric power station, Keage Power Plant, and it started its operation in 1891.

Although hydroelectric power generation was not included in the initial plan, utilizing the ideas Tanabe and other engineers picked up during their study tour in the US, they built Japan's first hydroelectric power station, Keage Power Plant, and it started its operation in 1891.
sen.cmt: 「the」削除, 「using ideas of Tanabe and other engineers inspired by」→「utilizing the ideas Tanabe and other engineers picked up during」
sen.e: Although hydroelectric power generation was not included in the initial plan, utilizing the ideas Tanabe and other engineers picked up during their study tour in the US, they built Japan's first hydroelectric power station, Keage Power Plant, and it started its operation in 1891.

sen.j: この電力を用いて、1895年（明治28年）には京都・伏見間で日本初となる路面電車、京都電気鉄道の運転が始まった。
sen.e: Using electric power from this plant, Kyoto Electric Railway started its operation of Japan's first streetcar which run between Kyoto and Fushimi in 1895.
Using electric power from this plant, Kyoto Electric Railway started the operation of Japan's first streetcar which ran between Kyoto and Fushimi from 1895.
Using electric power from this plant, Kyoto Electric Railway started the operation of Japan's first streetcar which ran between Kyoto and Fushimi from 1895.

sen.j: 鴨川合流点から伏見までの鴨川運河は、1892年（明治25年）に着工し、1894年（明治27年）に完成した。
sen.e: Construction of Kamogawa Canal, connecting Fushimi and the confluence point of Kamogawa River, was started in 1892 and completed in 1894.
Construction of Kamogawa Canal, connecting Fushimi and the confluence point of Kamogawa River, was started in 1892 and completed in 1894.
Construction of Kamogawa Canal, connecting Fushimi and the confluence point of the Kamo-gawa River, was started in 1892 and completed in 1894.
sen.cmt: "Kamogawa River"→"the Kamo-gawa River"に変更しました。

sen.j: その後、第1疏水でまかないきれない水道水や電力需要に対応するため、第2疏水が、京都市の三大事業（第2疏水事業、水道事業、市電開通及び幹線道路拡幅）の一つとして、1908年（明治41年）に着工され1912年（明治45年）に完成した。
sen.e: Later, with the aim to accommodate the water and electric power demand which First Canal was unable to meet, building Second Canal, or Dai-ni Sosui, was started in 1908 as one of the three major projects of Kyoto City (Second Canal, water supply, and city streetcar and expansion of main roads in the city), and was completed in 1912.

Later, with the goal of accommodating the water and electric power demand which First Canal was unable to meet, the construction of Second Canal, or Dai-ni Sosui, was started in 1908 as one of the three major projects of Kyoto City (the Second Canal, the water supply, and transport projects such as the city streetcar and expansion of main roads in the city), and was completed in 1912.
sen.cmt: 「aim to accommodate」→「goal of accommodating」, 「building」→「the construction of」,「the」挿入x2,「transport projects such as the」挿入
sen.e: Later, with the goal of accommodating the water and electric power demand which First Canal was unable to meet, the construction of Second Canal, or Dai-ni Sosui, was started in 1908 as one of the three major projects of Kyoto City (the Second Canal, the water supply, and transport projects such as the city streetcar and expansion of main roads in the city), and was completed in 1912.

sen.j: 蹴上浄水場はこのときに設置されている。
sen.e: Keage Purification Plant was built as a part of this project.
Keage Purification Plant was built as a part of this project.
Keage Purification Plant was built as a part of this project.

sen.j: 琵琶湖疏水は、京都・大津間および京都・伏見間の水運路として貨物・旅客ともに大いに利用されたが、1912年（大正元年）に開通した京津電気軌道（後の京阪京津線）など競合陸運の発展により旅客・貨物ともに衰退し、1948年（昭和23年）に旅客輸送は廃止され、蹴上インクラインも運転を停止した。
sen.e: Biwako Sosui prospered from transporting a huge amount of freight and a large number of passengers between Kyoto and Otsu, and between Kyoto and Fushimi, but due to the development of competing land transportation such as Kyotsu Electric Railroad (later, Keihan Kyotsu) which started in 1912, Biwako Sosui's business of freight and passengers both declined, and it abolished the passenger service and ceased the operation of Keage Incline in 1948.
sen.cmt: 京津電気軌道→Kyotsu Electric Railroad[定訳不明]
sen.e: Biwako Sosui prospered from transporting a huge amount of freight and a large number of passengers between Kyoto and Otsu, and between Kyoto and Fushimi, but due to the development of competing land transportation such as Kyotsu Electric Railroad (later, Keihan Kyotsu) which started in 1912, Biwako Sosui's freight and passenger business both declined, and it abolished the passenger service and ceased the operation of Keage Incline in 1948.

Biwako Sosui prospered from transporting a huge amount of freight and a large number of passengers between Kyoto and Otsu, and between Kyoto and Fushimi, but due to the development of competing land transportation such as the Kyotsu Electric Railroad (later, Keihan Kyotsu) which started in 1912, Biwako Sosui's freight and passenger businesses both declined, and it abolished the passenger service and ceased operation of Keage Incline in 1948.
sen.cmt: 文法間違い。 “ as Kyotsu Electric Railroad ”=> “as the Kyotsu Electric Railroad ” 複数形へ。“business”=>”businesses” 定冠詞不要。 “ ceased the operation”=>” ceased operation”

sen.j: 貨物輸送もその後自然消滅する形で廃止となった。
sen.e: Later, its freight transportation also gradually disappeared.
Later, its freight transportation also gradually disappeared.
Later, its freight transportation also gradually disappeared.

sen.j: 大津市三保ヶ崎に取水点があり、琵琶湖の水を取水する。
sen.e: Its head gate located at Mihogasaki of Otsu City, takes in water of Lake Biwa.
Its head gate located at Mihogasaki of Otsu City, takes in the water of Lake Biwa.
Its head gate located at Mihogasaki of Otsu City, takes in the water of Lake Biwa.

sen.j: 長等山を第1トンネルで抜け、山科区に出る（この第1疏水の京都市山科区の部分を山科疏水と呼称することも多い）。
sen.e: The flow runs through First Tunnel under Nagarasan Mountain to Yamashina-ku (this part of flow in Yamashina-ku of Kyoto City is also called Yamashina Canal).
The flow runs through First Tunnel under Nagarasan Mountain to Yamashina-ku (this part in Yamashina-ku of Kyoto City is also called Yamashina Canal).
The flow runs through First Tunnel under Nagarasan Mountain to Yamashina Ward (this part in Yamashina Ward of Kyoto City is also called Yamashina Canal).

sen.j: 山科盆地の北辺に沿って西に進んだ後、第2トンネル、第3トンネルを抜け、蹴上に出て第2疏水と合流する。
sen.e: It goes west along the north side of Yamashina Basin, runs through Second Tunnel and Third Tunnel, and reaches Keage to join Second Canal.
It goes west along the north side of Yamashina Basin, runs through Second Tunnel and Third Tunnel, and reaches Keage to join Second Canal.
It goes west along the north side of Yamashina Basin, runs through Second Tunnel and Third Tunnel, and reaches Keage to join Second Canal.

sen.j: ここは船溜まりになっており、かつてはここから南禅寺船溜までの間、船はインクラインに載せられていた。
sen.e: This confluent point was "funadamari", or a harbor where ships rested, and from here ships used to travel by the Incline to Nanzenji-funadamari, another terminal.
This confluent point was "funadamari", or a harbor where ships rested, and from here ships used to travel by the Incline to Nanzenji-funadamari, another terminal.
This confluent point was "funadamari," or a harbor where ships rested, and from here ships used to travel by the Incline to Nanzenji-funadamari, another terminal.

sen.j: 蹴上には蹴上浄水場、蹴上発電所といった施設があり水道水と電力を生み出している。
sen.e: In Keage, Keage Purification Plant and Keage Power Plant produced tap water and electric power.
In Keage, Keage Purification Plant and Keage Power Plant produced tap water and electric power.
In Keage, Keage Purification Plant and Keage Power Plant produced tap water and electric power.

tit.j: 蹴上～夷川発電所～伏見（鴨東運河・鴨川運河）
tit.e: From Keage, Ebisugawa Power Station, to Fushimi (Oto Canal and Kamogawa Canal)
From Keage via Ebisugawa Power Station to Fushimi (Oto Canal and Kamogawa Canal)
From Keage via Ebisugawa Power Station to Fushimi (Oto Canal and Kamogawa Canal)

sen.j: 琵琶湖疏水（第1疏水）の本流は蹴上船溜から蹴上インクラインにより南禅寺船溜まで下り、夷川ダム、夷川発電所を経て鴨川東岸を南下し墨染ダムに至る。
sen.e: The mainstream of First Canal runs from Keage-funadamari to Nanzenji-funadamari via Keage Incline, travels via Ebisugawa Dam, Ebisugawa Power Station, and runs south along the east side of Kamogawa River to Sumizome Dam.

The main stream of First Canal runs from Keage-funadamari to Nanzenji-funadamari via Keage Incline, travels via Ebisugawa Dam and Ebisugawa Power Station, and runs south along the east side of Kamogawa River to Sumizome Dam.

The main stream of First Canal runs from Keage-funadamari to Nanzenji-funadamari via Keage Incline, travels via Ebisugawa Dam and Ebisugawa Power Station, and runs south along the east side of the Kamo-gawa River to Sumizome Dam.
sen.cmt: "Kamogawa River"→"the Kamo-gawa River"に変更しました。

sen.j: 墨染ダムからは伏見インクライン（国道24号の拡幅用地に転用され現存せず）を経て濠川とつながる。
sen.e: From Sumizome Dam, it goes via Fushimi Incline (which does not exist today because it was merged to widened National Route 24) to join Hori-kawa River.
From Sumizome Dam, it goes via Fushimi Incline (which does not exist today because it was used to widen National Route 24) to join Hori-kawa River.
From Sumizome Dam, it goes via Fushimi Incline (which does not exist today because it was used to widen National Route 24) to join Hori-kawa River.

sen.j: ここからは、濠川（かつての伏見港を通る）もしくは疏水放水路・高瀬川を経て淀川に放水する。
sen.e: From here, it goes through Hori-kawa River (which runs through old Fushimi Harbor), or Takase-gawa River that was the Canal Discharge Channel, and empties into Yodo-gawa River.
sen.cmt: 疏水放水路・高瀬川→Canal Discharge Channel・Takase-gawa River[定訳不明]
sen.e: From here, it goes through Hori-kawa River (which runs through old Fushimi Harbor), or the Canal Discharge Channel, Takase-gawa River, and empties into Yodo-gawa River.
From here, it goes through the Hori-kawa River (which runs through old Fushimi Harbor), or the Canal Discharge Channel, the Takase-gawa River, and empties into the Yodo-gawa River.
sen.cmt: ”Hori-kawa River”→”the Hori-kawa River”に変更しました。"Takase-gawa River"→"the Takase-gawa Rive"に変更しました。"Yodo-gawa River"→"the Yodo-gawa River"に変更しました。

sen.j: このうち、南禅寺船溜から鴨川合流点までを鴨東運河（おうとううんが）、鴨川合流点より下流の部分を鴨川運河と呼ぶこともある。
sen.e: A part of the path between Nanzenji-funadamari and the confluence point of Kamogawa River is also called Oto Canal, and the downstream part from the confluence point, Kamo-gawa Canal.
A part of the path between Nanzenji-funadamari and the confluence point of Kamogawa River is also called Oto Canal, and the downstream part from the confluence point, Kamo-gawa Canal.
A part of the path between Nanzenji-funadamari and the confluence point of the Kamo-gawa River is also called Oto Canal, and the downstream part from the confluence point, Kamo-gawa Canal.
sen.cmt: "Kamogawa River"→"the Kamo-gawa River"に変更しました。

tit.j: 疏水分線（蹴上～南禅寺～松ヶ崎～堀川）
tit.e: Sosuibunsen Canal (from Keage, Nanzen-ji Temple, Matsugasaki, to Horikawa)
Sosuibunsen Canal (from Keage via Nanzen-ji Temple, Matsugasaki, to Horikawa)
Sosuibunsen Canal (from Keage via Nanzen-ji Temple, Matsugasaki, to Horikawa)

sen.j: 蹴上からは北に向かう疏水分線が別れており、南禅寺の境内を水路閣でまたぎ、法然院・慈照寺（銀閣寺）西方を通り北進し、その後700mほど今出川通と並走したのち、再び北進し、松ヶ崎浄水場へと流れていく。
sen.e: Sosuibunsen Canal branches out to the north from Keage, runs through Suirokaku (a high-rise structure of waterway) over the precinct of Nanzen-ji Temple, goes north along the west side of Honen-in and Jisho-ji Temple (Ginkaku-ji Temple), runs 700 m parallel to Imadegawa-dori, and goes north again to Matsugasaki Purification Plant.

Sosuibunsen Canal branches out to the north from Keage, runs through Suirokaku (a high-rise waterway structure) over the precinct of Nanzen-ji Temple, goes north along the west side of Honen-in and Jisho-ji Temple (Ginkaku-ji Temple), runs 700 m parallel to Imadegawa-dori, and goes north again to Matsugasaki Purification Plant.

Sosuibunsen Canal branches out to the north from Keage, runs through Suirokaku (a high-rise waterway structure) over the precinct of Nanzen-ji Temple, goes north along the west side of Honen-in and Jisho-ji Temple (Ginkaku-ji Temple), runs 700 m parallel to Imadegawa-dori, and goes north again to Matsugasaki Purification Plant.

sen.j: その後は下鴨から堀川に達する。
sen.e: From there, via Shimogamo it reaches Horikawa.
From there, via Shimogamo it reaches Horikawa.
From there, via Shimogamo it reaches Horikawa.

sen.j: 若王子神社から慈照寺（銀閣寺）付近までの疏水分線の堤は哲学の道という遊歩道になっている。
sen.e: The bank of Sosuibunsen Canal from Wakaoji-jinja Shrine to Jisyo-ji Temple (Ginkaku-ji Temple) provides a walking trail called Road of Philosophy.
The bank of Sosuibunsen Canal from Wakaoji-jinja Shrine to Jisyo-ji Temple (Ginkaku-ji Temple) provides a walking trail called Philosophers' Walk.
sen.cmt: To maintain continuity with existing terminology on Wikipedia I decided on 'Philosophers' Walk' http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philosopher%27s_Walk
sen.e: The bank of Sosuibunsen Canal from Wakaoji-jinja Shrine to Jisyo-ji Temple (Ginkaku-ji Temple) provides a walking trail called Philosophers' Walk.

sen.j: 第2疏水は第1疏水と同じく三保ヶ関で取水した後、ほぼ全線がトンネル（暗渠）であり、蹴上で第1疏水と合流する。
sen.e: Second Canal takes water in at Mihogaseki just like First Canal does, and almos all of it runs through tunnels (underground channel) until it joins First Canal at Keage.
Second Canal takes water in at Mihogaseki just like First Canal does, and almost all of it runs through tunnels (underground channels) until it joins First Canal at Keage.
Second Canal takes water in at Mihogaseki just like First Canal, and almost all of it runs through tunnels (underground channels) until it joins First Canal at Keage.
sen.cmt: 表現スタイル。 “ just like First Canal does”=>” just like First Canal”

sen.j: 第2疏水が暗渠であるのは、水道水源としての利用にあたり汚染を防ぐためとされる。
sen.e: The reason that Secon Canal was bulit underground is said to have been prevention from contamination so that it could be used as a drinking water source.
The reason that Second Canal was bulit underground is said to have been prevention from contamination so that it could be used as a drinking water source.
The reason that Second Canal was built underground is said to have been prevention from contamination so that it could be used as a drinking water source.

tit.j: 琵琶湖疏水と土木技術
tit.e: Biwako Sosui and civil engineering technology
Biwako Sosui and civil engineering technology
Biwako Sosui and civil engineering technology

sen.j: 琵琶湖疏水には日本で初めての技術が多数取り入れられており、近代化遺産として非常に価値が高い。
sen.e: Because Japan's firs technology was applied to many sections of Biwako Sosui, it is highly valuable as remains from the period of Japan's modernization.
Because technology used for the first time in Japan was applied to many sections of Biwako Sosui, it is highly valuable as a marker on Japan's path to modernization.
sen.cmt: 「Japan's firs technology」→「technology used for the first time in Japan」, 「remains from the period of Japan's」→「a marker on Japan's path to」
sen.e: Because technology used for the first time in Japan was applied to many sections of Biwako Sosui,it is a very valuable marker on Japan's path to modernization.
sen.cmt: “ it is highly valuable as a marker ” => “ it is a very valuable marker ”

sen.j: 第1トンネルは日本で初めて竪坑（たてこう）を使って掘られたトンネルである。
sen.e: The construction of First Tunnel used Japan's first vertical pits.
The construction of First Tunnel used Japan's first vertical pits.
The construction of First Tunnel used Japan's first vertical pits.

sen.j: 第1トンネルには竪坑が2つある。
sen.e: First Tunnel has two pits.
First Tunnel has two pits.
First Tunnel has two pits.

sen.j: 蹴上発電所は日本で初めての事業用発電所である。
sen.e: Keage Power Plant was Japan's first utility power plant.
Keage Power Plant was Japan's first utility power plant.
Keage Power Plant was Japan's first utility power plant.

sen.j: 発電機に使われていたペルトン水車が琵琶湖疏水記念館に展示されている。
sen.e: A Pelton wheel for the power generator is displayed at Lake Biwa Canal Memorial Museum.
A Pelton wheel for the power generator is displayed at Lake Biwa Canal Memorial Museum.
A Pelton wheel for the power generator is displayed at Lake Biwa Canal Memorial Museum.

sen.j: 蹴上浄水場は日本で初めての急速濾過式浄水場である。
sen.e: Keage Purification Plant used Japan's first rapid filtering system.
sen.cmt: 急速濾過式→rapid filtering system[定訳不明]
sen.e: Keage Purification Plant used Japan's first rapid filtering system.
Keage Purification Plant used Japan's first rapid filtering system.

sen.j: インクラインも日本で初めての施設である。
sen.e: The Incline was also Japan's first railway facility to connect calals.
The Incline was also Japan's first railway facility to connect canals.
The Incline was also Japan's first railway facility to connect canals.

sen.j: 蹴上インクラインの下を通っているトンネルの煉瓦はねじるような形で積まれており「ねじりまんぽ」と呼ばれている（まんぽとはトンネルの方言であると考えられている）。
sen.e: In the tunnel under Keage Incline, bricks are arranged in a twisting manner, so it is called "Nejirimanpo" (twisted tunnel) ("manpo" is considered a dialect meaning tunnel).
In the tunnel under Keage Incline, the bricks are arranged in a twisting manner, so it is called "Nejirimanpo" (twisted tunnel) ("manpo" is considered a dialect meaning tunnel).
In the tunnel under Keage Incline, the bricks are arranged in a twisting manner, so it is called 'Nejirimanpo' (twisted tunnel) ("manpo" is considered a dialect word meaning tunnel).

tit.j: 観光資源としての琵琶湖疏水

sen.j: トンネルになっていない区間のうち、大津市（第1疏水第1トンネル入口付近）、京都市山科区（山科疏水）、京都市東山区（インクライン周辺～鴨川）のいずれも、沿線にサクラが植えられている区間が多く、花が咲く時期には水と桜の織りなす大変美しい風景を見ることができる。
sen.e: People can enjoy the beautiful scenery consisting of water and cherry blossoms in their season because cherry trees are planted along most of the canal sections on the ground surface: Otsu City (in the neighborhood of the entrance of First Tunnel of First Canal): and in Higashiyama Ward of Kyoto City (from the area around the Incline to Kamogawa River).
sen.cmt: 大津市（第1疏水第1トンネル入口付近）→Otsu City (neighborhood of entrance of First Tunnel of First Canal)[定訳不明]
sen.e: People can enjoy beautiful riverside scenery of cherry blossoms in their season because cherry trees are planted along most of the canal sections: Otsu City (in the neighborhood of the entrance of First Tunnel of First Canal): and in Higashiyama Ward of Kyoto City (from the area around the Incline to Kamogawa River).
sen.cmt: The word 'water' on its own is perhaps vague, so I have replaced it with 'riverside'. "on the ground surface' has been removed as I think it doesn't add anything to the meaning of the sentence.
sen.e: People can enjoy beautiful riverside scenery of cherry blossoms in their season because cherry trees are planted along most of the canal sections without tunnels: Otsu City (in the neighborhood of the entrance of First Tunnel of First Canal): Yamashina Ward of Kyoto City (Yamashina Canal): and in Higashiyama Ward of Kyoto City (from the area around the Incline to the Kamo-gawa River).
sen.cmt: Yamashina Ward of Kyoto City (Yamashina Canal): 補足「トンネルになっていない区間のうち、」という意味が明確になるように訳出しました。"Kamogawa River"→"the Kamo-gawa River"に変更しました。

sen.j: 平安神宮南側の一部区間では観光シーズンなどに小型の遊覧船が就航することがある。
sen.e: A small pleasure boat sometimes cruise along the canal section on the south side of Heian-Jingu Shrine during tourist seasons.
Small pleasure boats sometimes cruise along the canal section on the south side of Heian-Jingu Shrine in the tourist season.
sen.cmt: I think it is likely that there are several boats. It would be more natural to use 'tourist season' even though there are several of these during the year.
sen.e: Small pleasure boats sometimes cruise along the canal section on the south side of Heian-Jingu Shrine in the tourist season.

sen.j: なお、大津から京都までの全区間に遊覧船に就航させてはどうかという提案がなされることがあるが、トンネル区間が多いことなどから実現されていない。
sen.e: Those proposals to operate pleasure boats along the whole section from Otsu to Kyoto have not been put into practice because there are too many tunnels.
Proposals to operate pleasure boats along the whole section from Otsu to Kyoto have not been put into practice because there are too many tunnels.
Proposals to operate pleasure boats along the whole section from Otsu to Kyoto have not been put into practice because there are too many tunnels.

sen.j: （現在、2010年に迎える「疏水完成120周年」の目玉事業として、トンネル区間を含んだ遊覧船就航やインクライン復活が京都商工会議所を中心に検討されている。
sen.e: (Kyoto Chamber of Commerce and Industry is leading the planning to operate pleasure boats along the whole course including tunnels and to revivie the Incline as the main projects for commemoration of "the 120th anniversary of the completion of Sosui" in coming 2010.)

(Kyoto Chamber of Commerce and Industry is leading efforts to operate pleasure boats along the whole course including tunnels and to revive the Incline as the main project for the commemoration of "the 120th anniversary of the completion of Sosui" in 2010.)

(Kyoto Chamber of Commerce and Industry is leading efforts to operate pleasure boats along the whole course including tunnels and to revive the Incline as the main project for the commemoration of 'the 120th anniversary of the completion of Sosui' in 2010.)

sen.j: 南禅寺境内にある水路閣はテレビドラマの撮影に使われるなど京都の風景として定着しているが、建設当時は古都の景観を破壊するとして反対の声もあがった（福澤諭吉も反対していたという）。
sen.e: There were oppositions against building Suirokaku in the precinct of Nanzen-ji Temple saying it would be a threat to the beauty of the ancient capital (Yukichi FUKUZAWA was said to be against it), but Suirokaku is now famous as a typical scenic spot in Kyoto as it often appears in TV drama scenes.

There was opposition against building Suirokaku in the precinct of Nanzen-ji Temple as some feared it would be a threat to the beauty of the ancient capital (Yukichi FUKUZAWA was said to be against it), but Suirokaku is now famous as a typical scenic spot in Kyoto as it often appears in TV drama scenes.

There was opposition against building Suirokaku in the precinct of Nanzen-ji Temple as some feared it would be a threat to the beauty of the ancient capital (Yukichi FUKUZAWA was said to be against it), but Suirokaku is now famous as a typical scenic spot in Kyoto as it often appears in TV drama scenes.
